page.title: 20A day in the Life of my Dad.
page.content: My Dad gets up at 7am on a weekday, washes, gets dressed, shaves, and goes downstairs for breakfast. He then drives to the office in Romsey. He looks at the post, answers any letters that need answering, and then enters into the account books any cheques received or items purchased. He may then continue with the design of a training program or discuss with customers their requirements, or may visit a customer or attend a meeting with a supplier. In the afternoon he will sign any letters and test any programs that are under developement. He may also organise the assembly of cassettes. In between 6 and 7 he arrives home, says goodnight to the younger children, or helps with homework, other times he may play games. After supper he does office work and goes to bed about 10.
